Description: Dataset sharing plan information. Used to indicate planned usage of MC2 Center supported Synapse projects.
Name of the dataset
Alias of the dataset. For Synapse storage, the Synapse id associated with the dataset should be used. Must be unique.
The type of data contained in this group of files. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
The species the data was collected on. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
The tumor type(s), if applicable, of the data collected on. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Tissue type(s) associated with the dataset. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
A list of file formats associated with the dataset. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
A unique primary key that enables record updates using schematic.
The level of processing associated with the dataset.
The number of files that will be uploaded as part of this dataset.
The number of biospecimens associated with the files included in the dataset
The number of individuals or model organisms from which samples were collected to generate the dataset.
The expected total storage space required for the dataset in gigabytes (GB)
A non-binding, estimated date by which the files are expected to be uploaded to a repository.
The projected date that marks the end of any requested or required sharing embargo for the dataset.
Grant number(s) associated with the dataset's development. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
The url of where the dataset is or will be stored.

DUO code - A data item that is used to indicate consent permissions for datasets and/or materials, and relates to the purposes for which datasets and/or material might be removed, stored or used. Available DUO code definitions can be found here: https://mc2-center.github.io/data-models/valid_values/sharingPlans/#attribute-dsp-data-use-codes
Examples: If a research institution is using certain data for health and medicine-based studies, then their DSP Data Use Codes could be "HMB".

Description: The Synapse Id for the executed IRB protocol or exemption document that was uploaded to Synapse. Required if human-derived data was generated for this study and will be uploaded as part of this dataset
A text description of the files contained in this dataset.
Examples: A quick description of your data sharing plan.

Description: An identifier representing the repository in which this dataset is intended to be held for long term preservation.
